DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Disease or Disorder Status Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the malignant disease or disorder status.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
